description.narrative: Goal Overview: To increase food security and reduce poverty of 750 subsistence farmers and their families in Madimba territory in Bas Congo province by assisting vulnerable communities to improve their agricultural practices and living conditions.

Project Plan: 750 farmers are trained infor a 3 years Farmers Club programme in the territory of Madimba in the Province of Bas-Congo. The identified villages are Mfuma, Ngufu and Kintanu. 3 units of 250 farmers each will be organized in the villages. One unit is made of 5 clubs of 50 farmers each. The project will organize a total of 15 farmers clubs of 50 farmers each totalizing 750 farmers. Each unit will be led by a farming instructor. Each club will elect among its members a committee of 5 literate members to organize and coordinate the activities of the club.

Summary: Humana People to People Congo (HPP-Congo) started up a farmer’s club program in Bas Congo province in the R.D.DR Congo. The actions of this program will result in food self-sufficiency and, production of marketable surplus to improve family economy. Living conditions will also be improved through lessons on hygiene, using clean safe water, nutrition, disease prevention etc. Campaigns and open days will be part of the program on quarterly and annual bases.

Target Groups: The direct beneficiaries are 750 farmers and their families in the territory of Madimba. The indirect beneficiaries are the community of Madimba benefitting from increased production, better health and nutrition and an increase of local economy as well as the population of Kinshasa that will buy products from farmers.
